head.p: Betreff: Racism in the USA to: alina.wolf@gmx

p.s: we have not seen each other for a long time.
I hope you and your family rae well.
As you know, I'm very interested about the discrimination against African Americans in the USA, and I thought that you are the perfet person to talk about that topic.
Yesterday, I found a germanGerman article, which was written from Alexandra Endres and published on Zeit Online, about the racial segregation in the USA.
Endrestalkestalks in her article about all the disadvantages back people have there, against white people.
She focussedfocused mainly about the education chances which are for white people way better than for blacks.
Furthermore, she claims that poverty is a big problem, but mainly for the black population.
I'm very interested about your own experiences.
Do you feel deprived in school?
I didn't expect the things Endres is telling in her article.
She says also that even 50 years after the sign of the civil rights from the president at that time, Lyndon B. Johnson, the descrimination on the blacks on paper ends, but not in reallifereal life.
I hope for your answer soon.
